page.title: 18THE NATIONAL TRUST 1.
page.content: Thanks to the National Trust, tourism is the most important industry in Culross today. In fact it's the only industry left. When Sir George Bruce's "Palace" came on the market in l932 the Trust bought it for Â£lOO. They now own more than 2O properties. BESSIE BAR'S HALL l6OO-malt house-Well reputedly purest water in Scotland. Adjacent building, arch and courtyard l796.Donated to Trust in l962.World Refugee Yr.THE PALACE OF SIR GEORGE BRUCE-2 buildings-inscriptions GB l597 and SGB l6ll.HOUSE WITH SUNDIAL- Sandhaven-block typical of Dutch style Merchants store sheds and living quar- ters on edge of harbour-before Forth receded.THE STUDY cl6lO, crowstep gables,corbelled outlook tower with windows to harbour and mercat cross for rich merchant.Restored Norwegian ceiling in living room on upper floor.
